page.title: 14CONSERVATION
page.content: {THE GEEDONS AND LANGENHOE MARSHES The Colne Estuary is of outstanding national importance for nature conservation,but the single most important part is the M.O.D ranges covering Langenhoe Marshes,and the Geedon Saltings.The whole area falls into 3 broad habitat types:Salt-marsh, brackish-marsh,and grassland ,with some scrub. {THE GEEDON SALTINGS}are one of the largest areas of unenclosed salt-marsh on the Essex coast,amounting to some 130 hectares.The winter grazing of up to 2000 black-bellied Brent geese make this area nationally important.Pewit and Rat Islands are the nesting sites for about 1000 black-headed gulls,and a few common terns. The Geedons were formerly used for sheep grazing.
